DataElement.preferredName: Brief Fatigue Inventory 4A Past 24 Hours Fatigue Interferes with General Activity Score 11 Point Likert Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how much fatigue has interfered with their general activity in the past 24 hours, using a 11 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Brief Fatigue Inventory Past 24 Hours Fatigue Interferes with General Activity Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 9-item questionnaire, developed by Cleeland and Mendoza, designed to assess the severity of fatigue and the impact of fatigue on daily functioning in cancer patients._The 24 hour period occurring just before the present time._A question about how an individual's fatigue interfered or interferes with their general activity._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: BFI Fatigue Interference 11 Point Likert Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard for the subjective scoring of fatigue interference that ranges from 0: Does Not Interfere to 10: Completely Interferes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure.  The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.  Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Question Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: Circle the one number that describes how, during the past 24 hours. fatigue has interfered with your:

ReferenceDocuments.name: BFI Scoring
ReferenceDocuments.description: A global fatigue score can be obtained by averaging all the items on the BFI.
